SEARCH
Package org.jarzarr

Class Loop

java.lang.Object
org.jarzarr.Loop
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Engine
public abstract class Loop extends Object implements Runnable
Simple fixed-timestep game loop runner.

This class owns the loop thread, controls start/stop, and calls:

  • init() once before the loop begins
  • update(double) zero or more times per frame using a fixed dt
  • render() once per iteration (frame)
  • cleanup() once after the loop ends

Timing model:

  • Updates run at target UPS (updates per second) using a fixed timestep.
  • Rendering runs as fast as the CPU allows, with a short sleep to reduce pegging.
  • Catch-up updates are capped to prevent spiral-of-death on slow frames.

  • Constructor Details

    • Loop

      public Loop()

  • Method Details

    • setDebug

      public void setDebug(boolean debug)
      Enables/disables debug counters printed once per second.
      Parameters:
      debug - true to print UPS/FPS counters

    • setTargetUPS

      public void setTargetUPS(double ups)
      Sets the target fixed update rate (UPS).
      Parameters:
      ups - updates per second (must be > 0)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if ups invalid input: '<'= 0

    • setMaxCatchUpUpdates

      public void setMaxCatchUpUpdates(int max)
      Sets the maximum number of catch-up updates per frame. Values invalid input: '<' 1 are clamped to 1.
      Parameters:
      max - maximum catch-up updates per render iteration

    • setStopDelay

      public void setStopDelay(int delay)
      Sets how long stop() waits for the loop thread to join.
      Parameters:
      delay - milliseconds (must be > 0)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if delay invalid input: '<'= 0

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the loop on a new thread if it is not already running. This method is synchronized to prevent double-start races.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Requests the loop to stop and joins the loop thread for up to stopDelay ms. This method is synchronized to prevent stop/start races.

    • run

      public void run()
      Loop thread entrypoint. Runs init(), then fixed-timestep updates + rendering until stop() is called, then runs cleanup().
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • init

      protected abstract void init()
      Called once before the loop starts (resource creation, scene setup, etc.).

    • update

      protected abstract void update(double dt)
      Fixed timestep update.
      Parameters:
      dt - fixed delta time in seconds (typically 1/targetUPS)

    • render

      protected abstract void render()
      Called once per frame to draw to the render target.

    • cleanup

      protected abstract void cleanup()
      Called once after the loop ends (resource disposal, shutdown hooks, etc.).
